content:
Announcing SUSHI 1.0.2. SUSHI 1.0.2 contains the following fixes and enhancements:

  • Enforces specific dependency library versions to ensure SUSHI installations behave as expected
    • This specifically fixes a bug related to ANTLR4 v4.9.0 and Node 14 that some users have experienced
  • Fixes handling of content references when the reference is more than a fragment
  • Adds a link to migration instructions when legacy projects are detected
  • New and improved puns! Try to find them all!

For more information, see the SUSHI 1.0.2 Release Notes.
i got this error message during install: npm ERR! enoent ENOENT: no such file or directory, chmod '/usr/local/lib/node_modules/fsh-sushi/dist/app.js'
solution: first uninstall the olde version with: npm uninstall -g fsh-sushi
That's a new one on me. I've never seen anyone have to do that before! Nice job finding a solution though!
Is there such a thing as an 'improved' pun?

David Pyke said:

Puns are perfect as conceived.

Puns come out of the oven fully baked?
